Rainbow Chard and Peas in Creamy gravy. Chard /Methi Matar Malai Vegan. Dairy-free creamy greens & peas w/ indian spices, somewhat like spinach dip
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2014/01/rainbow-chard-and-peas-in-creamy-gravy.html

One of my favorite ways to eat Fenugreek used to be Methi Malai Matar (Fresh Fenugreek leaves and Peas in creamy buttery sauce). The sauce generally has a good amount of cream, butter and sometimes grated Paneer cheese. This version of course, does not use any of that, it has non dairy subs and also uses Rainbow chard which is much more easily available in the Northwest. Some dried Fenugreek leaves help add the Methi flavor and result is amazingly delicious. Hence, Chard Malai Mutter. Think a spinach artichoke dip but more of a side. You can serve it like a dip with chips too. Spiced Indian style greens, peas and cream dip. Or Serve with Naan. 

#veganricha #easyveganrecipes #meethimatarmalai #creamedchardandpeas #veganindian
Music Epidemic Sound.

recipeIngredient: 1/2  Serrano chili pepper chopped or to taste
3-4  large chard leaves (chopped (chopped 2.5-3 cups packed) or use other Greens)
1/4 tsp cumin powder or cumin seeds
2 tsp Kasoori Methi (dried Fenugreek leaves or 1/4 tsp fenugreek seed powder)
1/4  loaded cup soaked cashews (soak in hot water for 15 minutes)
3/4 cup almond milk  (or non dairy milk)
1/4 tsp Kashmiri garam masala (optional (or use regular garam masala + a pinch of ground cloves))

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add oil and heat on low-medium heat. Add onions, chili, ginger and garlic and cook until onions are golden. Stir occasionally. If using ginger garlic paste, add to pan after onions are golden. Add the spices and mix well. Add chard, mix, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until wilted. (If using other greens adjust cooking time till wilted). Add peas and fenugreek leaves, mix and cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the soaked cashews with non dairy milk until well blended. Add the cashew cream, salt and sugar to the pan. Mix and cook on low heat until the cream just comes to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/4 tsp Kashmiri garam masala if you have some and mix. Taste and adjust salt and spice. Add cayenne if needed for heat. Add more water or non dairy milk if you like more gravy or thinner consistency. Serve hot with Naan, rotis, rice or quinoa. Or with Pita/chips as a dip!
